description.lang: Each individual IR control code can be encoded into an 80-bytes URID format. ZXT-310 utilizes 20 parameter numbers with 4 data bytes in each parameter to hold this 80 bytes UIRD data. Gateway or controller can use these Parameter Numbers to download UIRD data to ZXT-310.

These two bytes represent the Simple AV Command Number associated with the 80-bytes UIRD data going to be downloaded to ZXT-310. For example, user wants to set up an IR code for “Volume Down” and he has the IR control code in UIRD format. He would send the Simple AV Command Number, “0x0002”, using Parameter Number 21 to ZXT-310. Afterward, he would use Parameter Number 1 to 20 to transfer the corresponding URID data.

Download status register (Read only) 0000 0000: Idle - this IR channel is idle 0000 0001: OK - previous download is processed correctly 0000 0010: Downloading - ZXT-310 is busy processing previous download command 0000 0011: Full - UIRD data area of this IR channel is full. Each IR channel supports up to 64 learned or downloaded Simple AV command numbers or keys. It means that all locations are being used 0000 0100 : Failed - latest download process failed

These two bytes represent the Simple AV Command Number or key going to be learned. For example, user wants to learn the IR code for “Volume Down” of his TV set. He would send the Simple AV Command Number, “0x0002”, to ZXT-310 using Parameter Number 25. The status LED on ZXT-310 will turn on and stay on indicating it is in IR-learning mode. Gateway and Controller developers should poll the “Learning status register” (Parameter Number 26), and instruct end user to press and hold the “Volume Down” button of his original remote control for a few seconds. ZXT-310 will flash the status LED twice if the operation is successful. It will flash the status LED six times if it fails to learn the IR code or it doesn’t receive any IR signal for 15 seconds.

Learning status register (Read only) 0000 0000: Idle - this IR channel is idle 0000 0001: OK - latest learning process completed correctly 0000 0010: Learning - ZXT-310 is busy processing previous learning request. 0000 0011: Full - UIRD data area of this IR channel is full. Each IR channel can supports up to 64 learned or downloaded Simple AV command numbers or keys. It means that all locations are being used 0000 0100: Failed - latest learning request failed
IR code number of the built-in code library to be loaded to the “Simple AV Command Number to IR control code” mapping table
IR transmission power level 0x00: normal power mode 0xFF: high power mode (default) If IR output port routing is set to 1, IR transmission power level cannot be changed

IR output port routing 0x06: Route IR output from this Z-Wave-to-IR channel to IR Port 6 0x05: Route IR output from this Z-Wave-to-IR channel to IR Port 5 0x04: Route IR output from this Z-Wave-to-IR channel to IR Port 4 0x03: Route IR output from this Z-Wave-to-IR channel to IR Port 3 0x02: Route IR output from this Z-Wave-to-IR channel to IR Port 2 0x01: Route IR output from this Z-Wave-to-IR channel to IR Port 1 (default)
IR transmission mode 0x00: Continuous IR transmission mode (default) 0xFF: Single shot IR transmission mode
Check Library Version (Read Only) Byte 1 & 2 : Firmware Version Byte 3 & 4 : Library Version

End point selection control 0x01: end point 1 (default) 0x02: end point 2 0x03: end point 3 0x04: end point 4 0x05: end point 5 0x06: end point 6 Note: For controllers that do not support “multi-channel command class”, ZXT-310 will direct all received Z-Wave commands to Z-Wave-to-IR channel 1 or EP1 (the default channel). If controller developers want to support multiple AV equipment without “multi-channel command class” support, they can use this configuration command to select another active Z-Wave-to-IR channel. For example, controller would like to send command to Z-Wave-to-IR channel 3. It should send a configuration command with parameter 38 and data 0x03h making channel 3 as the active channel first, and then, send the desired command.
